<<<api>>>: InputStream.read
<<<code>>>: StringBuilder answer = new StringBuilder();
InputStreamReader inStream = new InputStreamReader(client.getInputStream());
BufferedReader inBuff = new BufferedReader(inStream);
char[] buffer = new char[1024];
int bytesRead;
while ((bytesRead = inBuff.read(buffer)) != -1) {
    answer.append(buffer, 0, bytesRead);
}
String result = answer.toString();
System.out.println("answer:\n" + result);
return result;
<<<explanation>>>: Instead of reading line by line, you can read chunks of characters at a time using a character buffer. This will improve the performance and avoid blocking. The code above reads characters into a buffer and appends them to a StringBuilder until there are no more characters to read. Finally, it converts the StringBuilder to a String and returns it.
